page.title: 05Case Tractors Ltd, Meltham
page.content: Tractors have been made at Meltham since 1939,at first by{David Brown Tractors, who were taken over by{Case in 1980.{Case Tractors}make a range of different tractors small and large to suit all needs.The colours are red, white, and black.They are easy to operate, efficient, simple and reliable and most have electronic controls.70% of the tractors are sent to U.S.A., Finland, Australia, New Zealand, Portugal, Greece, Sweden, Denmark, France and the rest of Europe. The other 30% are sold in Great Britain.{Case Tractors}are now one of the largest producers of construction equipment in the world. Recently a drop in world demand for tractors has led to many employees losing their jobs.
